meanings.definition: most inclined to form exclusive groups
meanings.sent1: She is the cliquiest girl in school, always sticking with the same friends.
meanings.sent2: The popular kids can be the cliquiest, often excluding others from their group.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the cliquiest group huddled in the corner, whispering and giggling.
meanings.sent4: The cliquiest members of the team formed an impenetrable circle, shutting out new players.
meanings.sent5: The cliquiest behavior can make others feel left out and lonely.

meanings.definition: displaying the characteristics of a clique
meanings.sent1: The students in the drama club were the cliquiest, always together and sharing inside jokes.
meanings.sent2: Her behavior became cliquiest when she started excluding others from group projects.
meanings.sent3: The cliquiest group at work always wore matching outfits on Fridays.
meanings.sent4: The cliquiest behavior in the office led to rumors and gossip spreading quickly.
meanings.sent5: The cliquiest attitude can create a sense of exclusion among colleagues.

meanings.definition: exhibiting the behavior of a clique
meanings.sent1: The girls in the lunchroom were the cliquiest, only allowing certain people to sit with them.
meanings.sent2: His behavior became cliquiest when he started ignoring his old friends.
meanings.sent3: The cliquiest group in the gym always saved the best equipment for themselves.
meanings.sent4: The cliquiest actions in the team caused tension and division among the players.
meanings.sent5: The cliquiest behavior can create a sense of exclusion and hurt feelings.
